internationalizations.description:
My path as a programmer has started at nineteen years old, when I've fallen in love with Logo, an educational programming language used to captivate kids in the wonderful lands of Programming. I used to spend hours in a row trying to build figures and animations, using math and geometry. At that time, I just did not know the exciting challenges that were yet to come.

A few years later, I got an internship as a Webmaster, since then, I have never stopped. It has been more than a decade, where I'm having the chance to work with marvelous people, learning every day, traveling the world, and mainly, always making great friendships.

I had an entrepreneurship experience, when a friend of mine presented me Magento, an extremely popular e-commerce framework. After doing several courses and a lot of practice, I got contracts with agencies from SÃ£o Paulo and Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. This entrepreneurship experience gave me the chance to see the other side of the coin, which contributed to sort of expand a bit more my consciousness as an employee.

Nowadays, I keep seeking new skills, learning and sharing my humble knowledge as much as possible.
